description: Understand and apply the fundamental accounting equation (Assets = Liabilities + Equity) to business scenarios
studentFriendlyDescription: Learn why a business's stuff (assets) always equals what it owes (liabilities) plus what the owners put in (equity)

description: Classify business accounts accurately into Assets, Liabilities, and Equity categories
studentFriendlyDescription: Sort business accounts into the right buckets: things you own, things you owe, and owner's stake

description: Construct a properly formatted Balance Sheet with correct account categorization and subtotals
studentFriendlyDescription: Build a financial snapshot that shows what a business owns and owes at a specific point in time

description: Analyze how business transactions affect the accounting equation while maintaining balance
studentFriendlyDescription: Track how business events change assets, liabilities, and equity without breaking the balance

description: Identify and correct common accounting errors including misclassifications and missing entries
studentFriendlyDescription: Spot and fix mistakes like putting accounts in the wrong category or forgetting to record something

description: Apply data validation techniques to ensure accounting data integrity and consistency
studentFriendlyDescription: Use Excel tools to prevent errors and keep your accounting data clean and reliable

description: Communicate financial position effectively through visual Balance Sheet representations
studentFriendlyDescription: Create clear charts and visuals that tell the story of a business's financial health
